controller.util

Class ReflectionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.util.ReflectionUtils

  • public class ReflectionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class with method to get info of class using reflection and validate the contract from operators and Registrable problems.

      • getNameOfProblem

        public static java.lang.String getNameOfProblem(java.lang.Class<? extends Registrable<?>> registrable)
        Read the NewProblem annotation from a problem and get the name of the problem.
        Parameters:
        registrable - the problem class
        Returns:
        name of the problem
        Throws:
        IllegalRegistrableException - if the problem hasn't a constructor with NewProblem annotation.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if registrable is null.

      • validateRegistrableProblem

        public static void validateRegistrableProblem(java.lang.Class<? extends Registrable<?>> registrable)
        Validate a Registrable problem.

        It validation in:

        1. Verify if registrable has only a public constructor
        2. Verify if registrable has NewProblem annotation in his only one constructor
        3. Verify if registrable has the same number of parameters has values defined in Parameters annotation in the constructor
        4. Verify if registrable has the parameters in the correct order and if the parameters are only of type Object, File, int or double or his wrapper Integer, Double. The order is (Object..., File ..., int|double ...)
        5. Verify if registrable's constructor parameters correspond to the type defined by Parameters
        6. Verify if registrable constructor doesn't have parameters when Parameters annotation isn't used


        The Parameters will be ignored if it isn't in the same constructor that the NewProblem annotation.

        Parameters:
        registrable - the registrable problem class.
        Throws:
        IllegalRegistrableException - if any of the conditions to be verified is not fulfilled.

      • validateOperators

        public static void validateOperators(java.lang.Class<? extends Registrable<?>> registrable)
        Validate operators defined in Parameters in the constructor. The validation consist in:

        1. Verify that all operators has DefaultConstructor in only one constructor.
        2. Verify that all operator has only int or double value in the default constructor
        3. Verify that the DefaultConstructor has the same number of elements that the parameters of constructor
        Parameters:
        registrable - the registrable problem that contain the Parameters with information of operators.
        Throws:
        IllegalOperatorException - if any of the conditions to be verified is not fulfilled.

      • getNewProblemConstructor

        public static java.lang.reflect.Constructor<?> getNewProblemConstructor(java.lang.Class<? extends Registrable<?>> registrableClass)
        Get the constructor with NewProblem annotation. If it constructor doesn't exist so return null.
        Parameters:
        registrableClass - the registrable class.
        Returns:
        The constructor with NewProblem annotation
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if registrableClass is null.

      • getDefaultConstructor

        public static java.lang.reflect.Constructor<?> getDefaultConstructor(java.lang.Class<?> classType)
        Search the default constructor. The constructor with DefaultConstructor annotation.
        Parameters:
        classType - the class where find the default constructor
        Returns:
        constructor with DefaultConstructor annotation if exit. null if it doesn't exist.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if classType is null.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the number of parameters in operator default constructor.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if classType is null or there isn't a default constructor.

      • createRegistrableInstance

        public static <T extends Registrable<?>> T createRegistrableInstance(java.lang.Class<? extends Registrable<?>> registrableClass,
                                                                     java.lang.Object[] parameters)
                                                              throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Create a new instance of Registrable problem when it has parameters.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of class.
        Parameters:
        registrableClass - the registrable class.
        parameters - the parameters of constructor of registrable class. If there is no parameter receive a empty array (new Object[0]).
        Returns:
        the registrable instance.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - if there are any exceptions when the new instance is being created.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the underlying constructor throws an exception.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if registrableClass or parameters is null.

        public static <T extends Registrable<?>> T createRegistrableInstance(java.lang.Class<T> registrableClass)
                                                              throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

        Parameters:

        Throws:

        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the underlying constructor throws an exception.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if registrableClass is null.

                                               throws java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        Create a new instance of operator problem when it has parameters.
        Parameters:

        parameters - the parameters of constructor of registrable class. If there is no parameter receive a empty array (new Object[0]).
        Returns:
        the operator instance.
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - if there are any exceptions when the new instance is being created.
        java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - if the underlying constructor throws an exception.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if operatorClass or parameters is null.
